1.title: Part One: Introduction
1.plot: Director Alex Winter's documentary recalls the groundbreaking launch of Napster and the legal battles that sank the company. Downloaded focuses on two teenage friends, Shawn Fanning and Sean Parker, who came up with a groundbreaking internet start-up while they were in college, dropped out and moved to northern California to launch their company.

2.title: Part Two: The Disrupters
2.plot: In this clip, the origins of Napster are discussed and in depth conversations with the founders are featured.

3.title: Part Three: The Last Record Men
3.plot: This clip highlights the shift in the overall music industry and record labels after mp3s found their way into the mainstream. Interviews with talent like Henry Rollins, DJ Spooky and record executives are included.

4.title: Part Four: Bigger Than AOL
4.plot: In this clip, the Bay Area and the dot com boom are profiled. There are exclusive interviews with former Napster employees and high profile musicians who discuss how the audience got to the technology first.

5.title: Part Five: Here There Be Pirates
5.plot: In this clip, artist Alanis Morisette testifies before congress, Beastie Boy Mike D is interviewed and music industry executives discuss how piracy was rampant throughout the industry.

6.title: Part Six: The Center Cannot Hold
6.plot: In this clip, the Bay Area and the dot com boom are profiled. There are exclusive interviews with former Napster employees and high profile musicians who discuss how the audience got to the technology first.

7.title: Part Seven: You Say You Want a Revolution
7.plot: In this clip, the record companies approach to digital music is discussed along with how the war on piracy came to be.

imdb.title: Downloaded
plot: A documentary directed by Alex Winter exploring the Napster downloading revolution the kids who created it, the bands and businesses that were affected and its impact on the world at large.
